result.execSummary:
The defendant Beau James Sebastian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED INFORMATION

10:25 Defendant Beau James Sebastian in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Beau James Sebastian in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: guilty to amended charged in amended informtion. Files amended information. Requesting time served. Nelson and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to amended charge contained in the amended information; Nelson stipulates to factual basis for conviction.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to amended charge contained in amended information. Froelich and Nelson address sentencing. Court: approves agreement and sentences Def to time served.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on February 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
State's

Thorie wants to keep def here until case is resolved.  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.

4:40 Defendant Beau James Sebastian in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Beau James Sebastian in custody.  Sean E Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of the information. Court reads charges and maximum penalties; Def waives further reading. Def pleas not guilty. Court: not guilty plea is entered. Hargrove states MN is willing to come get him.  Court: set this for status in 60 days. Froelich requests this be converted to a $3000 signature bond. Court orders a $3000 signature bond but Def will still remain in our custody until MN picks him up. Court does understand the def will not be present for status hearing. Court reviews bond conditions with Def.
Arraignment on January 31, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
